executive_summary: Plastics and rubber machinery manufacturers produce machinery used to make or process plastic and rubber products, such as equipment for blow molding, extruding and injection molding. Machinery produced by this industry is used by downstream customers to manufacture various goods for

current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Automakers use machines manufactured by this industry to make plastic and rubber products, such as tires, dashboards and interior panels. Revenue for the car manufacturing industry (IBISWorld report 33611a) has decreased over much of the past five years due to declining car sales and shifting consumer preferences. The automotive industry is still struggling to recover from the downturns of the pandemic as consumer preferences have shifted due in large part to the recent increases in remote work.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Low-Cost Imports Pose a Significant Threat
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: As downstream manufacturers have increasingly moved operations overseas, plastic and rubber machinery manufacturers have followed, increasing the potential base for foreign goods to penetrate the US market. Supply chain efficiencies, lower wage costs and fewer regulations have enabled manufacturers in foreign countries to produce machinery at lower prices than their US counterparts. In turn, these savings are passed on to the consumer in the form of lower prices, siphoning revenue away from domestic manufacturers.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: NONRESIDENTIAL CONSTRUCTION EXPECTED TO PICK UP
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Plastics and rubber machinery manufacturers serve the construction markets through machinery which produces construction essentials such as floor coverings and pipes. While robust residential construction has characterized most of the current period, the drastic reversal of nonresidential construction activity during the COVID-19 pandemic temporarily offset these gains. Nonresidential construction activity is expected to rise in 2024 as investment in different commercial and industrial structures continues.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: HIGHLY VOLATILE CRUDE OIL PRICES HINDER GROWTH
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Crude oil is a key ingredient in manufacturing plastics, so its cost directly affects demand for plastics and rubber machinery. The world price of crude oil dropped amid the COVID-19 pandemic as complications significantly disrupted all types of economic activity.

Steel is a major input in the production of machinery for plastics and rubber industries. Manufacturers have attempted to pass down increased input cost to downstream markets by raising prices, but the volatile nature of steel cannot be offset by rapidly changing selling prices. Rapidly fluctuating input costs have also negatively affected industry profit in recent years.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: The Elimination of Covid-19 Restrictions Will Lead to Higher Demand From Automakers
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: As the economy recovers due to widespread vaccine distributions, travel patterns will resume and demand for rubber products, such as tires, dashboards and interior panels, will pick up. The world price of oil rebounded in 2021 as the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries (OPEC) curbed its production levels. This trend continued through 2022, causing industry revenue to grow for the year. Oil prices are volatile and subject to sudden changes due to global conditions. During the current year, oil prices remain uncertain.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: A Higher Demand for Quality and a Depreciating Dollar Will Propel Exports
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The recovery of industry revenue can also be largely attributed to favorable trade conditions over the next five years. Domestic plastics and rubber machinery manufacturers will benefit from relatively strong international demand for higher quality components. A depreciating US dollar would spur demand, as a weaker dollar can make domestically produced goods more attractive to overseas buyers. Still, low-cost imports will continue to remain competitive and constrain industry revenue.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: The Nonresidential Construction Market is Set is Recover
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The nonresidential construction market will recuperate as the economy recovers from previous declines due to the COVID-19 pandemic's impact on the sector. As commercial construction activity improves, demand for plastic pipes used in plumbing will grow. The key segments of the nonresidential construction market include office and commercial space expansion, which will be lifted by restored business sentiment, in addition to hospital and educational building construction, supported by expanding government budgets. Strong corporate profit, along with a rebound in macroeconomic conditions, will boost aggregate commercial spending and private construction.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Product Innovation and Environmental Concerns are Set to Boost Manufacturing Activity
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Downstream plastic and rubber product manufacturers focus on product innovation. For example, downstream plastic sheet producer Spartech LLC has many proprietary property rights for product formulations. The company also attributes the introduction of new products based on alternative technologies as a basis of competition. Environmental concerns, including the use of recycled plastics and the manufacturing of easily recyclable plastic products, also influence the industry's customer markets. Companies that manage to anticipate and capitalize on innovations in downstream manufacturing processes will be poised to release updated machinery that is capable of accommodating new production techniques.

industry_definition: Companies in this industry manufacture machinery used to make or process plastic and rubber products, including equipment for blow molding, calendering, plastic-compression molding, extruding, injection molding, plastic working, rubber working, tire making, tire recapping and tire shredding. The receipts received from service and repair work are included in this industry.
key_trends: Volatile oil and steel prices harm the industry. Rapid increases in input costs cannot be quickly offset with increased selling prices.
Low-cost imports pose a significant threat. Domestic plastics and rubber machinery manufacturers are responding to this by focusing on higher quality products.
Nonresidential construction work continues to fall. The COVID-19 pandemic halted activity within the nonresidential building market and forced businesses to revise construction plans.

Plastics and rubber machinery manufacturers are under heavy environment and noise regulation. These include the Clear Water Act, Resource Conservation and Recovery Act, Clean Air Act, the Cluster Rule and noise control governed by the US Code.
Tariff protection has a significant influence on domestic demand. There is a moderate level of tariff protection against imports of steel products.
Plastic molding machinery remain the industry's largest product segment. Rubber-working machinery and equipment also accounts for a significant portion of demand.

Plastics and rubber machinery manufacturers choose to locate themselves near suppliers, making the Great Lakes the most popular choice to set up establishments. Manufacturers are able to quickly and conveniently acquire raw material while saving on transportation costs.

The Southeast region is a popular location for manufacturers. The presence of downstream manufacturing and industrial industries are responsible for the high level of plastics and rubber machinery manufacturers in this region.

Competitive pricing is key to attracting downstream customers in a relatively low-margin industry. Plastics and rubber machinery manufacturers must also be able to deliver a range of high-quality products.

Having a diverse product line at various price points and quick turnaround is highly important. Due to the constant threat of low-cost imports, domestic plastics and rubber machinery manufacturers tend to have tight profit.
The industry is highly fragmented. Still, Hillenbrand is a large company that dabbles in numerous manufacturing industries, most notably in coffin and casket production.
Husky Injection Molding Systems Ltd garners a small market share but has been on the rise. This increase is contributable to their product innovations.
Purchases are the largest cost for plastics and rubber machinery manufacturers. Raw material prices are the largest expense and have been volatile in recent years.
Despite technological innovations, labor costs are very high. Plastics and rubber machinery manufacturers require skilled workers to properly operate complex machinery.

market_segmentation.segment_description: A large proportion of demand for plastics and rubber machinery is satisfied by downstream industrial manufacturers.
Medical-related industries purchase extruder machinery for producing film and sheets to ensure medical products are sealed and sanitary.
Automotive industries use rubber machinery to produce tires for autos and aircrafts, retreading materials, inner tubes, tire repair materials, belts and hoses.
Blow molds created by this industry are commonly used by consumer good manufactures to make packaging for beverages, food, household cleaners, cosmetics and other chemical products.
The electronics market has grown over the past five years as electronics grew more prevalent in the global economy.
The construction sector purchases plastic mold machinery for the production of plumbing piping, bathroom items, fixtures and fittings.
Manufacturers of plastic films, sheets and bags use this industry's machinery to produce a diverse range of packaging materials.

products_and_services.product_description: Other receipts include related equipment and accessories, molds and mold boxes, sales of used equipment and scrap, contract work and the manufacture of secondary products.

Plastic molding refers to the injection of pelletized resins into injection molding machines and is a manufacturing process used to produce a wide array of items ranging from bottle caps to plastic buckets.
The major products within the rubber-working machinery and equipment segment are machines associated with tire processing.
Extrusion refers to the process of heating resin pellets, then feeding the pellets into an extruding machine that shapes the heated plastic into tubing.

tier_2_suppliers: Metal Pipe & Tube Manufacturing in the US
Ball Bearing Manufacturing in the US
Pump & Compressor Manufacturing in the US
tier_1_buyers: Rubber Product Manufacturing in the US
Laminated Plastics Manufacturing in the US
Hose & Belt Manufacturing in the US
tier_2_buyers: Plastic Products Miscellaneous Manufacturing in the US
Car & Automobile Manufacturing in the US
SUV & Light Truck Manufacturing in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Demand from Plastics and Rubber Products Manufacturing
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Manufacturers of plastic and rubber products use this industry's machinery in their production processes. Increased demand for plastics and rubber products also boosts production for those industries.
The trade-weighted index measures the value of the US dollar against the country's major trading partners.
Fluctuations in the world price of crude oil produce instability for plastic manufacturers downstream.
The world price of steel is a key factor that affects the demand for plastics and rubber machinery.
A strong US dollar threatens domestic manufacturers as it demotivates foreign buyers from purchasing US exports.

international_trade_points.trade_description: The industry imports more than it exports due to more affordable labor costs and looser regulations overseas.
In August 2018, the United States imposed a 25.0% tariff on various Chinese import items, including steel products.

international_trade_points.trade_title: The Largest Destination for Industry Exports is Mexico, Followed by Canada
international_trade_points.trade_description: Industry trade with Canada and Mexico benefit from advantageous trade conditions with the United States through the United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement (USMCA).

international_trade_points.trade_title: A Depreciating Dollar Will Boost Export Volumes Over the Next Five Years
international_trade_points.trade_description: A decreasing trade-weighted index (TW), will benefit industry exports as domestically produced goods become comparatively less expensive for foreign customers.

business_locations.location_description: The Great Lakes region is automotive central, with the Big Three US auto manufacturers General Motors, Ford, and Fiat Chrysler based in Michigan.
The presence of suppliers in the Southeast is responsible for the distribution of plastics and rubber machinery manufacturers in this region.
Along with being the most populous state, California is home to the largest number of establishments and employees in the manufacturing sector.

regulations_points.regulation_description: Plastics and rubber machinery manufacturers must acquire quality certifications, which are recertified on a semi-annual basis.

regulations_points.regulation_title: THE CLEAR WATER ACT (CWA) AND THE RESOURCE CONSERVATION AND RECOVERY ACT (RCRA)
regulations_points.regulation_description: Under the CWA and RCRA, manufacturers are responsible for ensuring that appropriate water and solid waste discharge procedures have been followed.
The CAA is designed to protect and enhance the nation's air resources to protect public health and welfare.
The Cluster Rule protects human health and the environment by reducing toxic releases to the air and water.
Noise regulation is governed by the US Code.
In response to CDC guidance, various levels of regulation have been implemented in the United States and overseas.

barriers_points.barrier_description: Plastics and rubber machinery manufacturing is highly labor-intensive.
Manufacturers require skilled workers to operate the machinery and computer software.
Manufacturers must also acquire managerial expertise.

basis_points.basis_description: Competitive pricing is key to attracting downstream customers in a relatively low-margin industry.
Plastics and rubber machinery manufacturers must also be able to deliver a range of high-quality products.

basis_points.basis_title: Diverse product line and quick turnaround
basis_points.basis_description: Having a diverse product line at various price points and quick turnaround is highly important.
Due to the constant threat of low-cost imports, domestic plastics and rubber machinery manufacturers tend to have tight profit.

concentration_points.concentration_description: Plastics and rubber machinery manufacturers are localized and market specific.
Plastics and rubber machinery manufacturing exhibits a low level of fragmentation due to the presence of many small companies.
Since major companies have been better equipped to absorb fluctuations in steel and aluminum prices, their market share has remained relatively stable over the past five years.
Still, revenue for large manufacturers has fluctuated along with the volatility of inputs and economic slowdowns caused by the COVID-19 pandemic, but less than that of smaller manufacturers.

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Purchases are estimated to account for 46.5% of industry revenue in 2024.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: For companies that enter into fixed-price contracts with suppliers instead of purchasing at spot-price rates, short-term fluctuations in raw material prices have had little effect on profitability.
SKILLED LABOR IS HIGHLY IMPORTANT, RESULTING IN HIGH WAGE COSTS
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Wages have increased over the past five years, accounting for an estimated 30.2% of industry revenue in 2024.
Profit has remained flat the past five years, accounting for an estimated 6.3% of industry revenue in 2024.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Plastics and rubber machinery manufacturing is highly labor-intensive.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: Low levels of innovation limit the threat to incumbent operators from new technologies disrupting their operations.

volatility_points.volatility_description: Revenue is highly influenced by fluctuations in industrial production and general economic activity.

volatility_points.volatility_title: THE PRICE OF KEY INPUTS INTRODUCES SIGNIFICANT VOLATILITY
volatility_points.volatility_description: Industry selling prices depend on the price of steel and crude oil.

FAQs.question: What drives industry revenue and increases sales?
FAQs.answer: An increase in downstream demand from key sectors, such as the construction and automotive industries, drives industry revenue growth by investing in capital and machinery.

FAQs.question: What percentage of your revenue is allocated toward marketing expenses? Do opportunities exist for your company to capture a greater share of the market via an increase in marketing?
FAQs.answer: Marketing costs only take a fraction of revenue since the industry is limited to specialist customers in niche markets due to the specialized nature of our products.

FAQs.question: How has your company dealt with the rising level of import penetration into the manufacturing sector?
FAQs.answer: The industry is engaged in a high level of international trade. Still, both imports and exports have declined as a share of revenue through the end of 2023.

FAQs.question: Does your company invest greatly in research and development?
FAQs.answer: The complexity and precision of products requires a lot of research and development to keep up to date with consumer preferences while also improving the quality and performance of equipment.

FAQs.question: Does your company implement new technology in its operations?
FAQs.answer: New and improved machine technology has been implemented to reduce expenses, boost production capacity and increase overall efficiency.

FAQs.question: How does your company accommodate the growing needs of environmentally friendly consumers?
FAQs.answer: As customers have an increased interest for environmentally friendly machinery, manufacturers have redesigned some products to produce machinery which is energy efficient and minimizes waste.

FAQs.question: How has your company dealt with an increase in environment, health and safety regulations over the past several years?
FAQs.answer: Companies invest heavily in research and development to keep up with new health, safety and environmental requirements and to develop new products that minimize the discharge of waste.

FAQs.question: How do you measure the efficiency of your operations and the quality of the products your company manufactures?
FAQs.answer: Manufacturers acquire quality certifications on a semi-annual basis which measures the standards of a company's operations and services.

FAQs.question: How has your company sought to minimized profit fluctuations over the past several years?
FAQs.answer: Any sharp increase or decrease in input prices, such as the price of steel or oil, can affect profit.

FAQs.question: How can you stabilize your purchases costs in a period of volatile input prices?
FAQs.answer: Entering into fixed-price contracts with suppliers rather than purchasing at sport-price rates helps to stabilize purchasing costs.

FAQs.question: How do you attract and retain qualified staff? How do you keep wages competitive?
FAQs.answer: Operators need to develop machinery that meets critical performance standards, including strength, durability, conductivity, lubricity, temperature tolerance and chemical resistance.

FAQs.question: How quick is your company to adopt the latest technology?
FAQs.answer: Operators must be able to take advantage of new production techniques and product technologies as they become available.

FAQs.question: How does your company foster long-term relationships with upstream suppliers?
FAQs.answer: Most operators establish long-term relationships with customers as a result of providing reliable, high-quality products and collaborative efforts to design and develop application-specific machinery.

FAQs.question: As a major input cost, how does your company maintain profitability when the price of steel fluctuates?
FAQs.answer: Similar to most manufacturing industries, purchases consistently account for the single-largest industry expense.

FAQs.question: How has your company's backlog trended over the past 12 months?
FAQs.answer: While production and capacity utilization are essential indicators of demand for plastics and rubber machinery, investment levels indicate how much business actually spend on industrial equipment.

FAQs.question: What percentage of your sales are derived from foreign markets?
FAQs.answer: With exports forming a major component of industry revenue, exchange rates are key to understanding revenue movements.
